content:
Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 1 of 30.


Your forces:
- Your carrier AC1: position (5, 3), stationary, HP 100/100, speed 2, vision 4.
- Your squadron ASQ1: on board a carrier, ready to launch., HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.
- Your squadron ASQ2: on board a carrier, ready to launch., HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 1: Objective is to find the enemy carrier as quickly as possible. My carrier (AC1) is at (5, 3) and the enemy carrier is expected near (26, 26). The direct distance is too far for a single squadron launch from my current position. Therefore, I will launch one squadron (ASQ1) to scout the furthest possible point towards the enemy's expected location. I will also move my carrier slightly southeast to improve future scouting range and position. ASQ2 will be kept in reserve for follow-up actions. ASQ1 will target (20, 19), which is approximately 21.9 hexes away, maximizing its initial scouting reach towards the enemy's starting area.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 6, "y": 4}, "launch_target": {"x": 20, "y": 19}}}

ERROR: invalid your order, rejected: launch_target was rejected. x=20 y=19 is out of squadron range. Please specify a valid coordinate, such as x=19 y=19.
Please fix your order.

{"thinking": "Turn 1 (Revised): My previous launch target (20,19) was out of range. The system suggested (19,19) as a valid coordinate. I will adjust the launch target for ASQ1 to (19,19) to ensure it is within operational range, while still aiming to scout as far southeast as possible towards the enemy's expected location (26,26). My carrier AC1 will proceed with its planned move to (6,4) to better position for subsequent turns and improve future scouting range. ASQ2 remains in reserve.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 6, "y": 4}, "launch_target": {"x": 19, "y": 19}}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 2 of 30.

Recent events:
- your squadron(ASQ1) set a new target toward position (19, 19) while at (6, 5).

Your forces:
- Your carrier AC1: position (6, 4), en route to target (6, 4), HP 100/100, speed 2, vision 4.
- Your squadron ASQ1: position (6, 5), outbound toward (19, 19), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.
- Your squadron ASQ2: on board a carrier, ready to launch., HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 2: ASQ1 is en route to (19,19), covering the southeast sector. To expand our search area and increase the probability of early enemy detection, I will launch ASQ2 to scout another sector. Given the enemy's expected position near (26,26), I will direct ASQ2 to (25,8), which covers a more easterly-southeast approach. My carrier AC1, now at (6,4), will continue moving southeast towards (10,8) to further advance its position, improving future squadron launch ranges and maintaining a good distance from the potential enemy location.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 10, "y": 8}, "launch_target": {"x": 25, "y": 8}}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 3 of 30.

Recent events:
- your squadron(ASQ2) set a new target toward position (25, 8) while at (8, 6).

- Your squadron ASQ2: position (8, 6), outbound toward (25, 8), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 3: Both ASQ1 (towards 19,19) and ASQ2 (towards 25,8) are currently outbound on their scouting missions, covering a broad sector towards the enemy's expected location. My carrier AC1 is moving towards (10,8) to advance its position and reduce the distance for future squadron actions. Since both squadrons are airborne and the carrier is en route, there are no new orders to issue this turn. I will maintain current courses and await reconnaissance reports from the squadrons.", "action": {"carrier_target": null, "launch_target": null}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 4 of 30.

- Your carrier AC1: position (8, 7), en route to target (10, 8), HP 100/100, speed 2, vision 4.

- Your squadron ASQ2: position (12, 6), outbound toward (25, 8), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 4: Both ASQ1 and ASQ2 are continuing their scouting runs towards their designated targets (19,19) and (25,8) respectively. My carrier AC1 is also still en route to (10,8). No new enemy contact or events have occurred. I will maintain the current orders and wait for the squadrons to report their findings. The goal remains to locate the enemy carrier as quickly as possible.", "action": {"carrier_target": null, "launch_target": null}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 5 of 30.

{"thinking": "Turn 5: Both ASQ1 and ASQ2 have made contact with enemy squadrons (BSQ2 and BSQ1 respectively). The enemy squadrons appear to be moving west/northwest, suggesting their carrier is likely positioned to the east or southeast of their current locations, reinforcing our initial estimate of the enemy carrier being in the southeast quadrant (e.g., near 26,26). My carrier AC1 is currently at (10,8). To close the distance for a potential attack launch once the enemy carrier is located, and to keep out of the immediate path of the enemy scouting planes, I will move AC1 further southeast to (12,10). Both ASQ1 and ASQ2 will continue their current scouting missions, as they have not yet located the enemy carrier. Their current trajectories are still well-suited for covering the high-probability areas for the enemy carrier.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 12, "y": 10}, "launch_target": null}}

Below is the current battle situation from your perspective.

Turn 6 of 30.

- your squadron(ASQ2) spotted an enemy squadron(BSQ1) at (16, 9) while at (19, 7).

- Enemy squadron BSQ2: last known position (11, 18) (previously at (14, 18)), HP 40/40.

- Your squadron ASQ2: position (19, 7), outbound toward (25, 8), HP 40/40, operational range 22, speed 4, vision 5.

{"thinking": "Turn 6: Critical update! ASQ1 has successfully located the enemy carrier, BC1, at (21, 18) and is now en route to attack it. This gives us a crucial advantage. My carrier, AC1, is currently at (11, 9). Enemy squadrons BSQ1 (last seen at 16,9) and BSQ2 (last seen at 11,18) are approaching my general position. To capitalize on the enemy carrier discovery and avoid being detected or attacked by enemy scouts, I need to reposition AC1 to a safer, more concealed location while remaining within range for future launches. I will move AC1 northwest to (9, 8). Furthermore, ASQ2 is still on a scouting mission. I will immediately redirect ASQ2 to join ASQ1 in attacking the newly discovered enemy carrier BC1 at (21, 18) to deliver a decisive blow.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 9, "y": 8}, "launch_target": {"x": 21, "y": 18}}}

ERROR: invalid your order, rejected: launch_target was rejected. Currently, all air squadrons are deployed on missions, and there are no squadrons aboard the carrier. Orders cannot be issued to squadrons that are already deployed.
Please fix your order.

{"thinking": "Turn 6 (Revised): My previous order to launch ASQ2 was invalid as ASQ2 is already airborne. ASQ1 has successfully located the enemy carrier BC1 at (21, 18) and is now automatically targeting it for attack, which is excellent. ASQ2 is currently on its way to (25,8). I cannot issue new launch orders for an already deployed squadron. Therefore, ASQ2 will continue its current mission. My carrier AC1 is at (11,9). To avoid detection and potential attack from enemy squadrons BSQ1 (last seen at 16,9) and BSQ2 (last seen at 11,18), which are moving towards my general area, I will proceed with my plan to move AC1 northwest to a safer position at (9,8). The focus is now on ensuring AC1's safety while ASQ1 engages BC1, and hoping ASQ2's current path might also bring it into contact with BC1.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 9, "y": 8}, "launch_target": null}}

According to the rules, I cannot redirect an airborne squadron until it returns to the carrier. Therefore, ASQ2 will continue its current mission. My carrier AC1 is moving towards (9, 8), which is a good defensive move to avoid detection by the enemy squadrons (BSQ1 and BSQ2) spotted earlier, which appear to be moving towards my general area. I will maintain AC1's current movement to ensure its safety while ASQ1 continues its attack.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 9, "y": 8}, "launch_target": null}}

This means AC1 is in immediate danger. My previous carrier target (13,8) would move it closer to BSQ2, which is unacceptable. I must prioritize AC1's survival. Therefore, I will move AC1 northwest to (8,6) to rapidly distance it from both enemy squadrons. ASQ1 is already en route to attack the enemy carrier (BC1) at (17,13). ASQ2 is on board and ready; I will launch it to also target BC1 at (17,13) to deliver a decisive strike and finish off the damaged enemy carrier as quickly as possible.", "action": {"carrier_target": {"x": 8, "y": 6}, "launch_target": {"x": 17, "y": 13}}}
